title: Top Shelf - Image Check
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the app has been installed
AND moved to the Top Shelf area
custom_steps: WHEN we select/highlight the app
custom_expected:
THEN the static image presented along the top of the ATV4 home screen appears as expected
AND (as of 2017 Postseason) App icon text reads "MLB" 

**There have been issues with Apple Requirements in which the image dimensions were incorrect - currently 2320x720 - but this is not something CDQA needs to confirm as it would be flagged by submission tools**

title: App Icon - Image Check
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the app has been installed
custom_steps:
WHEN we select/highlight the app
AND move the direction pad in all directions - slightly, not enough to nav away
custom_expected:
THEN we see the image and the app icon appears as expected 
AND the layers are set in a way that does not appear odd or incorrect
AND (as of 2017 Postseason) App icon text reads "MLB" 

[NOTE: It is not possible to confirm app title text with non-retail builds - only image is being checked here]

title: App Version
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the app has been installed
AND the app has been launched
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate to Settings
custom_expected:
THEN the version text appears as expected in the bottom right corner

Example:
version: 2.3.0 (1362)

title: Side Load - Install Fresh and Hard Quit
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have access to the latest Prod-facing build in test
AND the MLB.TV app is not installed on our device
AND we have access to a Premium Account
custom_steps:
WHEN we install the build
AND we log in with a Premium Account
AND we exit the app
AND we tap the tvOS remote's Home button to return to tvOS Home
AND we double tap the Home button (it has "Monitor" graphic on it)
AND we swipe up to Hard Quit the app
AND we relaunch the app
custom_expected:
THEN the app launches as expected to the expected view
AND the user is logged in to the same account

title: Side Load - Install Over Previous App - Logged In - Notifications On
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the side load version of the previous release (LIVE)
AND we have previously logged in to the app in the previous release
AND we have set Notifications to ON 
AND we have selected Fav/Follow teams
AND we have access to the latest Prod-facing build in test
custom_steps:
WHEN we Side load the current build in test
AND we launch the build
custom_expected:
THEN the app launches as expected to the expected view
AND we do not see the onboarding flow screens
AND the user is logged in to the same account
AND the version has updated correctly to the current build

title: Side Load - Install Over Previous App - Logged In - Notifications Off
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the side load version of the previous release (LIVE)
AND we have previously logged in to the app in the previous release
AND we have set Notifications to OFF
AND we have selected Fav/Follow teams
AND we have access to the latest Prod-facing build in test
custom_steps:
WHEN we Side load the current build in test
AND we launch the build
custom_expected:
THEN the app launches as expected to the expected view of Notifications Opt-In
AND we do not see the onboarding Get Started/Login screens
AND the user is logged in to the same account
AND the version has updated correctly to the current build (confirm via Setting)

title: Side Load - Install Over Previous App - Favorite Teams added locally
custom_preconds:
User has logged in to previous (retail) version of app - __must be debug, not actual store version__!
And Favorites/Follows have been added (and noted by tester)
And current build in test is installed OVER previous version
custom_steps: Launch app from tvOS home
custom_expected: THEN when viewing Favorites/Follows in Settings all previous Favorites/Follows are retained

title: Free Account - Email Address max character limit
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the app is launched
AND the user is not logged in
custom_steps:

AND sees a Create FREE account button
AND selects/activates it
AND selects/activates 'Email Address' field
custom_expected: THEN the user can enter an email address up to 32 total characters in length

title: Create Free MLB.TV account - opt in newsletter
custom_preconds:
Freshly installed app is launched 
User is not logged in 
User has advanced through Onboarding flow to Create Account page
User has a test email account that can be accessed
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter an email address
AND create a PW 8-15 characters in length with at least one upper-case letter, one lowercase letter and one number
AND confirm password
custom_expected:
THEN the app logs the user in 
AND advances to the In-Game alerts page
AND the user's email account is set to receive the newsletter

To confirm this, user must send opted-in email account to DBAdmin@mlb.com asking them to confirm that it has been tagged with opt-in group “428” 

--

Example:

Hi DB Admin,

Can you please help me verify that an account created by our tvOS MLB.tv app has successfully opted in to receive MLB.com Newsletters?

Though there is an open issue about this group code, for the purposes of this test I am checking to make sure that one user successfully opted into opt-in group “428” and that the other did not.

camlbtest@qsss.com - opt in
cdsf33@mlbtest.com - no opt in

Please let me know if you need any more information, and thanks in advance for the help.

[Your Name]

title: Create Free MLB.TV account - opt out of newsletter
custom_preconds:
Freshly installed app is launched 
User is not logged in 
User has advanced through Onboarding flow to Create Account page
User has a test email account that can be accessed
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter an email address
AND create a PW 8-15 characters in length with at least one upper-case letter, one lowercase letter and one number
AND confirm password
custom_expected:
THEN the app logs the user in 
AND advances to the In-Game alerts page
AND the user's email account does not show an opt-in to receive the newsletter

To confirm this, user must send the email account to DBAdmin@mlb.com asking them to confirm that it has been NOT tagged with opt-in group “428” 

--

Example:

Hi DB Admin,

Can you please help me verify that an account created by our tvOS MLB.tv app has successfully opted in to receive MLB.com Newsletters?

Though there is an open issue about this group code, for the purposes of this test I am checking to make sure that one user successfully opted into opt-in group “428” and that the other did not.

camlbtest@qsss.com - opt in
cdsf33@mlbtest.com - no opt in

Please let me know if you need any more information, and thanks in advance for the help.

[Your Name]

title: Create Account Failure - Invalid Email Format
custom_preconds:
Freshly installed app is launched 
User is not logged in 
User has advanced through Onboarding flow to Create Account Page
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter an invalid email format (e.g. "hello.me@com")
AND any password 8-15 Characters in length & proper format (one number/upper-case letter/lower-case letter)
AND we activate Create Account
custom_expected:
THEN the app shows an error overlay:
_Invalid Email  - Please enter a valid email address_
AND this can be dismissed 
AND the user is returned to Create Account Page

title: Create Account Failure - Invalid Password - Length
custom_preconds:
Freshly installed app is launched 
User is not logged in 
User has advanced through Onboarding flow to Create Account Page
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter a valid email address
AND any password in violation of the requirements - 8-15 Characters in length, one number, at least one upper-case & one lower-case letter
AND we activate Create Account
custom_expected:
THEN the app shows an error overlay for length violation:
_Password Length - Password must be at least 8 and no more than 15 characters_
AND this can be dismissed 
AND the user is returned to Create Account Page

title: Create Account Failure - Invalid Password - Bad Format
custom_preconds:
Freshly installed app is launched 
User is not logged in 
User has advanced through Onboarding flow to Create Account Page
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter a valid email address
AND any password 8-15 Characters in length BUT in violation of the requirements (missing requirement of one number, at least one upper-case & one lower-case letter)
AND we activate Create Account
custom_expected:
THEN the app shows an error overlay for length violation:
_Password too simple - Password must at east one character, one number, one uppercase letter and one lowercase letter_
AND this can be dismissed 
AND the user is returned to Create Account Page

title: Create Account Failure - Existing Account
